data.text: @timonealpt @alwayscoldcasey @FloridaAAP The WHO has been pretty spot on. They recommended no travel bans because they never work. Masks traditionally have worked in all pandemics and still do. Vaccines work and need to be given to the entire world. So much info was weaponized as well. It was such a shame.
@timonealpt @pyroptosisguy @TheShoeLady33 @FloridaAAP @GovRonDeSantis They are suffering from Mass psychosis. Bless their hearts
@timonealpt @pyroptosisguy @TheShoeLady33 @FloridaAAP @GovRonDeSantis 😂 You did great. He was such a troll.

@jenmyers333 @alwayscoldcasey @FloridaAAP If just one person had humility enough to say, "we got it wrong."

With no masks then masks.
2 weeks to flatten the curve. 
Don't trust the Trump vaccine. 
Limiting travel is racist....

All of it. 

The messaging has been so contradictory and non-transparent.

@vanaynay15 @TheShoeLady33 @FloridaAAP @GovRonDeSantis Not even close. Do you know how many kids have died from the flu over the last two years since the pandemic started? 8. In the meantime, 1,576 kids have died from COVID. What number is bigger, 8 or 1,576?

@6fores1 @DLewisMD @SocialCreditGOV @FloridaAAP I saw beautiful smiling faces. We had virtual afternoons and we had mask breaks. I saw many kids smile with their eyes. I could hear their voice tones. They loved being with their friends.

@timonealpt @alwayscoldcasey @FloridaAAP It's not the science that is bad, it's that we have lost faith in government institutions. This has been a slow erosion over many  years. Governments only exist when the governed believe that they have the right to exist. Both sides have failed our body politic.

@timonealpt @alwayscoldcasey @FloridaAAP People in the US do not think in the collective. It makes public health initiatives very difficult to enact. During WW2, there was an enormous amount of "propoganda" that had to be used to get a societal buy in for the war effort. This would be nearly impossible now.

@timonealpt @alwayscoldcasey @FloridaAAP The potential risks of vaccines have always been far less than the illness. However, human nature pushes us in the direction of inaction even when the risk is higher than action when the risk is lower. We're wired this way. Not choosing to get vaccinated makes us feel better.
